result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles K Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Straight Time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles K Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles K Moore in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Charles K Moore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  STRAIGHT TIME.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/30/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/30/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Charles K Moore in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/30/3015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Charles K Moore appears late to court. Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal was present in Court.  Ronald Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is reassigned to Branch 15, Judge Watts due to assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Charles K Moore in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Charles K Moore in custody.  
Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark  Branch 17.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles K Moore
Current: 2647 N 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 04-18-2015)
Prior: 1345 W. Locust Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
